description.narrative: We provide health care, education and balanced meals to 400 children in a poor slum in Caracas during the COVID-19 pandemic. The success of the Foundation started 23 years ago and is based on the life stories of more than 550 alumnus who have achieved differentiating goals through formal education. The true significance is that they emerge from marginalization and enter the productive society by accessing formal jobs.

mailing-address.narrative: 7 avenida entre 6 y 7 transversal, Urbanizacion Altamira, Colegio Cristo Rey Caracas 1060 Venezuela

title.narrative: A Boy without arms lost parents due to COVID

description.narrative: Talandira aboy born without arms now an Orphan after his mother died due to COVID19 left him without nothing to eat, wear, need health attentions, his eyes ussually itches a problem from birth he need much food every morning you can imagine once given food and he talks.

title.narrative: Send 210 Cambodian Youth Back to School

description.narrative: Public school is free--but not the notebooks, backpacks, or uniforms. When Cambodian youth go back to school in January after a 10-month break due to Covid-19, some students won't be going. They don't have the basic supplies they need to attend. With your support, we can send 210 youth back to public school with a full backpack! Mission Dove Cambodia has identified the most at-risk students in our 4 target communities to receive this support.

mailing-address.narrative: House 428, St. 26 BT, Boeung Tumpun Phnom Penh 12351 Cambodia

description.narrative: Indigenous Guatemalan women face layers of oppression as women in a patriarchal society, a discriminated-against Indigenous minority in a colonized country, and that as Indigenous people, they are three times more likely to be living in extreme poverty. The COVID-19 pandemic only exacerbates these conditions. Join us in providing jobs and job training, peer to peer counseling and health services, and the tools & guidance needed to gain the resilience and self-determination they need to thrive.

mailing-address.narrative: 700 W Franklin Richmond, VA 23220 United States

title.narrative: AID FOR REOPENING REQUIREMENTS FOR THE ORPHANAGE

description.narrative: The project targets to enable the orphans to resume school amidst the covid-19 after the government announced school reopening Guidelines and SOPs which are essential for every institution and require immediate funding therefore our aim is to offer full free education to the orphans under our care which includes the finalist that will seat for their exams march early next year. we need to expand our classroom blocks , toilets and dormitories for social distancing, teachers quarters, sick bay.

mailing-address.narrative: Wakiso Nansana kabumbi Kampala, A 26846 Uganda

title.narrative: Crack a Smile - Relief for Kids

description.narrative: The critical winter season in Pakistan starts from mid-December to mid-January every year. Populations below the poverty line; hit by cold and Covid-19 pandemic this winter will end up in critical situation. Children of daily wagers will be prone to food scarcity and winter chills. To cater reality of approaching winter and food insecurity, PMS will provide food ration packs and winter clothing for greater social well-being by sharing hope and solidarity with impoverished children.

mailing-address.narrative: house 346, G 14/4, Islamabad Islamabad 46000 Pakistan

title.narrative: United Against Hunger in the Rio Grande Valley

description.narrative: COVID-19 is more than a viral pandemic in the Rio Grande Valley of Texas. It has created an economic crisis affecting a disproportionate percentage of our population. The Rio Grande Valley is one of the poorest places in the United States. The safety net isn't large enough or sturdy enough to support all of those who are suffering from food insecurity stemming from near record unemployment levels. We are distributing food--lots of food. And we're working together to do it better.

organisation.narrative: United Way of Southern Cameron County

mailing-address.narrative: 634 E Levee St Brownsville, TX 78520 United States

title.narrative: PROVIDE FOOD ITEM FOR 300 NIGERIA VULNERABLE WOMEN

description.narrative: This project will help in providing food items for 300 vulnerable women who lives in the local community in FCT Abuja. This women and their families are helpless and have no food to eat in their homes. This will help to alleviate hunger and hardship Caused by COVID-19 PANDEMIC which has left fear of the unknown in the minds of these Vulnerable women and families. This project will bring them Hope, Joy and Happiness knowing that Our Organization cares for them and brings food relief items.

organisation.narrative: The Fageli good health advocacy & lifestyle foundation

title.narrative: Accompany 200 women that live violence in Oaxaca

description.narrative: Violence towards women, adolescents and girls have increased significantly in this time of COVID-19 confinement: only between January and April 2020, 13 women were murdered violently in Tehuantepec isthmus, and an increase in domestic violence was reported. Indigenous women in many time don't know the complaint mechanism or lost much time for inefficiency of some authorities. These situations lead the women, in many times to desist from the process, then, this violation of rights goes unpunished

organisation.narrative: Centro para los Derechos de la Mujer Naaxwiin A.C.

title.narrative: Deliver Health Care to Needy Families in Lombok

description.narrative: Lombok, next to Bali, has had serious setbacks in recent years. First a devastating earthquake in 2018, then COVID-19 and the loss of tourism has left the local economy devastated and thousands without homes. People can't afford food, basic goods or healthcare. Many are still living in tents, even 3 years later. Bumi Sehat Lombok operates both a permanent clinic and a mobile health service in the North. The area was already underserved before the quake and healthcare needs are critical.

organisation.narrative: Yayasan Bumi Sehat, Ds. PKR Nyuh Kuning

mailing-address.narrative: Jalan Nyuh Bulan Nyuh Kuning Gianyar, Gianyar 80571 Indonesia

title.narrative: Beat Covid & up wellbeing of +500 elders in Brazil

description.narrative: We are providing care, protection, and wellbeing support. We are infusing hope to older adults living in long-term care institutions in the outskirts of Sao Paulo city (Brazil), and to their families. We are giving protective equipment, educational, health and key emotional support to more than 500 older adults, the most vulnerable public to complications and death caused by Covid 19, representing the leading risk factor for a catastrophic situation. For us to continue, your donation is vital!

mailing-address.narrative: Ferreira de Araujo Street, 221 Building no. 93 - Alto de Pinheiros Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo 05428-000 Brazil

title.narrative: Ultimate Peace Grads Making Real World Impact

description.narrative: Ultimate Peace (UP) is a groundbreaking leadership development program, annually uniting 400 Arab and Jewish youth in the Middle East. Playing the self-officiated sport of Ultimate Frisbee, teens compete, learn to resolve differences, build trust, and become friends across cultural divides. While COVID-19 has curtailed in-person activities, Leader in Training Program graduates are charging forward in their young adult lives, enacting the values of Ultimate Peace in the most profound ways.

mailing-address.narrative: Barhoum null En Rafa, En Rafa Israel

title.narrative: COVID-19 Food & Home Relief for Families in Oyugis

description.narrative: Living conditions in Kenya were already tough, then COVID-19 hit and things got even worse! Families in desperate need are asking for your help...they are out of food, and many are about to lose their homes and become homeless. Wages have been stopped or severely cut. Many families already living on less than $1 a day lost even that minuscule amount. Your help is needed today to feed families, keep them in their homes and help them survive through this tough period.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 744 Gladstone, OR 97027 United States

title.narrative: Promote stay in school & decrease drop out rates

title.narrative: LEGAL AID FOR ASYLUM SEEKERS IN GREECE

description.narrative: A.Ss.I.S.T. currently provides vital legal aid and information to asylum seekers, most of whom reside in Vial Reception Identification Centre (RIC) on Chios, renowned for overcrowding, substandard living conditions and inadequate medical, legal and other basic services. Since the start of the COVID-19 Pandemic, A.Ss.I.S.T. has been delivering services digitally and is now serving clients in the larger Athens metropolitan area, using a cloud-based, virtual country level office.

mailing-address.narrative: Aplotarias 44 Chios 821 00 Greece

title.narrative: Let's take care of the elderly in DR from COVID-19

description.narrative: El Proyecto es una iniciativa de la Fundacion Xiomara Urena B. en equipo con la por la Fundacion Funcomas que busca salvar vidas cientos de adultos mayores que estan siendo afectadas por la crisis actual causada por el COVID-19. Este proyecto te da la oportunidad de apoyar a garantizar alimentacion, salud y educacion para los envejecientes afectados y sus dependientes directos. Ademas, con este apoyo damos un respiro economico a sus familias con ancianos, que son que no cuentan con el respaldo.

description.narrative: COVID-19 Pandemic is threatening everyone's way of life but for those vulnerable people living in poverty, the potential impact is massive. Help and funding are needed urgently for 500 vulnerable families who have been hit severely by the effect of coronavirus pandemic. Your donation will be used to address the emergency need of these vulnerable families in Nigeria and enhance their chances of surviving the onslaught of this pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Ibenabor Village, Oraukwu, Idemili North Local Government Area Onitsha 420001 Nigeria

title.narrative: Keep Maasai Girls Learning in Kenya

description.narrative: This project will fund the relaunch our core programs for Maasai girls in the Loita Hills region of Kenya now that schools are re-opening from COVID-19 closures. Specifically, the project will increase Maasai girls' access to education by activating local leadership to support and champion girls' education, enrolling children in primary school and working with schools and communities to add on secondary day schools, providing low-cost secondary education to thousands.

mailing-address.narrative: 1002 Cooper Ave Suite 100 Glenwood Spgs, CO 81601 United States

title.narrative: Support Lifesaving Emergency Care in Tanzania

description.narrative: FAME advances high-quality health care for under-resourced communities in rural Northern Tanzania. Serving a catchment area of 2.9 million people, FAME operates a modern hospital, lab, outpatient clinic, maternity center and reproductive & child health clinic. This year FAME has partnered with local government to take the lead in Covid-19 treatment, prevention and management in our region. Please join us on Giving Tuesday to help boost our pandemic and overall emergency response capabilities.

organisation.narrative: Foundation for African Medicine and Education

mailing-address.narrative: 4553 Crimsonwood Dr. Redding, CA 96001 United States

title.narrative: Relieve the COVID 19 impact on Patients in Nepal

description.narrative: 2020 has been a challenging year. So many people have been sick, lost loved ones, jobs, and livelihoods. But how much more impact has this year had on those who were already on the brink of poverty and disease throughout the world? Please help us relieve the impact of COVID 19 on our patients in Nepal. We know how effective Acupuncture and Herbal medicines are on patients with all viruses, from COVID 19 to flu, to chronic disease and malnutrition. Help us make a difference this holiday season.

mailing-address.narrative: 1011 W Wellington Ave Suite 220 Chicago, IL 60660 United States

title.narrative: Combat Corona to the Last Mile In Kenya

description.narrative: In Kenya, most people live from hand to mouth, with 40% of the people living below the poverty line and 50% just above it. For our community, staying home makes it difficult to get necessities like soap, food, and salt. This project is acting in response to the COVID outbreak or its consequences, through raising awareness about prevention, supporting vulnerable populations during the economic stop-down. MCDC plans to support 200 households to access ,food ,shelter,education and healthcare .

title.narrative: Help Setup Village Classrooms Amid School Shutdown

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has adversely affected the primary education of children since the Government shutdown and due to the implementation of safety measures, primary schools have not reopened. As an alternative, FFLV has come up with an idea of home schools for small kids till 5th grade for whom online classes would have been too difficult if not impossible. Not only can we provide these students with the essential learning but can also reconnect with them and know they are safe and well.

mailing-address.narrative: 8909 West Ln Magnolia, TX 77354 United States

description.narrative: This project covers the needs of Migrant workers and enhances access to fundamental rights. FED methodology is one of "working alongside", encouraging and empowering individuals and communities - FED uses a rights based approach. Addressing the needs of migrant workers affected by the coronavirus pandemic to ensure the accessibility of health care, justice and social recovery by both governments. Raising awareness of the coronavirus protection and prevention knowledge among migrant population.

mailing-address.narrative: 20 Moo 4 Khuk Khak Takuapa Phang Nga, Phangnga 82220 Thailand

The Covid crisis has unleashed a series of problems in the population and it is essential to support to resolve the situation. 180 children are cared for.

description.narrative: Hurricane ETA has deepened the challenges in the areas of economy, health and education that the most vulnerable communities in Honduras faced due to the almost 10 months of confinement as a preventive measure against COVID - 19. While we work supporting families affected by Storm ETA, Hurricane Iota arrived in our country leaving more rain and destruction, floods and landslides could be aggravated by the effects of both hurricanes in less than 15 days, affecting the same areas.

title.narrative: Urgent Covid Relief for Girls to Continue Learning

description.narrative: Edu-GIRLS' agenda to lift girls out of poverty using its 10 Mantra approach had been jolted by COVID threatening financial ruin, leaving girls on the street and arresting learning. A $100,000 COVID Action Agenda I has distributed 1M meals, set up 600 digital learning devices and motivated teachers to worker smarter. With COVID wave 2, the fight intensifies. Vaccination drives and basic treatment facilities need to be set up to save girls, families and staff and prepare for school reopening.

BASILDON NEEDS YOUR MONEY TO HELP THESE LOCAL ORGANISATIONS MEET THE DEMAND! We are appealing on behalf of two of these local mental health groups Motivated Minds and The Listening Post. description.narrative: Eswatini has the 3rd highest youth unemployment on the planet (1 in 2 youth are without work). The economic crisis resulting from COVID has worsened the situation and riots erupted there in July 2021. Entrepreneurship & quick employment is the only hope for this desperate situation. We help youth start enterprises & get internships. Your donation will facilitate entrepreneurship, micro-loans & enable business mentoring & match internships for youth. We seek to do this for 1000 youth in Eswatini.

description.narrative: The Atutu Learning Center provides a high school education to girls from under-invested regions in Kachin State, Myanmar. Atutu has asked the Tekkatho Foundation to support the girls with learning during Covid-19 closures and beyond. With your donations to this project, we can provide quick and reliable access to world class educational resources to the girls of Atutu through our low-cost, offline digital library: MyLibrary. Funds beyond $1250 will go toward a further new eLibrary in Chin State.

title.narrative: Deliver Pandemic Maternal Health Care in Bali

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has devastated the Bali tourism economy. The Indonesian government requires pregnant women to pay for a COVID-19 test before giving birth. Families may borrow money or take away from other essentials, like food or medicines, to cover birth costs. Bumi Sehat Bali provides maternal health services by-donation or free, so Indonesian families in Bali don't go into debt or poverty for healthcare.

This left many people loosing employment and facing the threat of food insecurity. Loss of income also meant the inability to have hand sanitisers and face masks. HOPE Africa has been working in partnership with communities to raise funds for food distribution, food vouchers, clothing distribution and the distribution of santisers and masks.

We will include at least 25 school children from Zagreb and 25 people with intellectual disabilities of the Regoc Association from Slavonski Brod. Workshops "Skillful Hands " and learning how to make handicrafts from wood and fabric will alleviate the stress and fear of Covid 19, but also the fear for their loved ones.

description.narrative: The pandemic is causing gaps in learning, increasing school dropouts and inequality, which will affect children into adulthood. The situation in rural communities, is even more devastating since families don't have internet access to continue children's education and parents have lost income. This project aims to overcome the educational lag and keep children interested in learning, in outdoor and sanitized space, where they can freely explore and discover; share and learn with proper guidance.

title.narrative: MEDACROSS - AIDS patients are not alone in Myanmar

description.narrative: There are more than 240 thousand people living with AIDS in Myanmar. For those people, finding a job and have medical healthcare is a daily struggle, because AIDS is a strong stigma in Myanmar. Coronavirus has worsened their situation since they are heavily immunosuppressed. MedAcross help AIDS patients in South Myanmar with free medical visits and medicines, giving health counselling and providing clean food and water to avoid additional illnesses. Help us don't let down who has no one else.

Education is being provided through online distance learning platforms and access to a computer at home is a prerequisite to use these platforms. However, only 40% of disadvantaged students have a computer at home in Turkey. Therefore, CYDD started a campaign to provide computers to disadvantaged students who are already getting scholarship from CYDD.

Hospitals are overrun and the COVID death toll continues to rise. Hurricane Eta has further devastated the country. It took Honduras over 20 years to recover from Hurricane Mitch, and now Hurricane Eta has caused similar devastation-this time during a pandemic. Mayor Potencial will help mitigate the effects by providing care packages and shelter.

title.narrative: Get 15,000 Kenyan children safely back to school

description.narrative: Education has been on hold for thousands of Kenyan children since schools closed their doors in March 2020 as a result of the COVID-19 crisis. As schools in Nairobi's informal settlements prepare to reopen in January 2021 without any government support, they need your help to create a safe space for children to return to learning. Dignitas believes that all schools should be vibrant places for children to thrive and succeed so that no child is left behind!

description.narrative: This project will support women to give birth safely and have access to essential services ensuring their baby will survive and thrive to celebrate their 5th birthday. COVID-19 has reversed progress made in supporting mothers and babies in poor and marginalised communities in Kericho County, Kenya. Inaccessible health services, fear of COVID-19, lack of soap and water has increased unsupervised home births which risk the lives of mothers and babies. Help us reverse this trend.

Families living in crowded refugee camps find social distancing impossible. In countries already ravaged by years of war, their weakened health systems lack doctors, ventilators, medicine, and testing capabilities. Your gift will help us provide communities with vital assistance, including clean water, lifesaving food, and face masks.

The work of this much valued centre, which supports its members to enjoy Independent Living, is being frustrated by current restrictions of the pandemic. The number attending is now limited to 6, whilst the day to day running costs that ordinarily provide facilities for 20 members, remain much the same. Our aim is for the Centre to maintain the excellent service that it provides to the elderly people of Halstead and the surrounding villages.

description.narrative: As a result of COVID-19, many Australian families are experiencing job loss or hardship in these uncertain times. Children are particularly impacted by the distress of their parents. St Vincent de Paul Society NSW is working with families to reduce the risk of homelessness. An emergency food hamper may not seem like something that can change a life - but it is. That is why a donation is so important. On Giving Tuesday help provide essential support to vulnerable families by making a donation.

organisation.narrative: St Vincent De Paul Society NSW

mailing-address.narrative: 2C West Street Lewisham 2049 Australia

title.narrative: At great risk of being left behind

description.narrative: Since March, due to Covid, the needs of young people with special needs have been neglected by the Department of Education, as they are unable to study or receive therapies and services that are necessary to continue their education. It is widely recognized that remote education is not adequate for this exceptional population. The project seeks to defend the rights of this under-served population by ensuring they receive some form of face-to-face education and other essential services.

organisation.narrative: Servicios Legales de Puerto Rico, Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: 1859 Ave Ponce de Leon San Juan 00909-2009 Puerto Rico

title.narrative: ReNew Hope for Autism in Covid Times

description.narrative: Family dynamics has a big impact on a family's wellbeing. When a member(s) has autism, designing, implementing and managing a structured, predictable environment, and routine improves day to day living for all. We provide our families and caregivers tailor-made personal advice, guidance and intervention strategies to address their family dynamics. We have re-invented our services to help and accompany our families meet their needs, while ensuring our community stays safe, healthy and productive.

mailing-address.narrative: Zona Rental Universidad Metropolitana Edif. 1, Piso 2, Terrazas del Avila, Caracas 1070 Venezuela

description.narrative: This project will help protect seahorses of Vilankulo, Mozambique that are particularly vulnerable to poaching since Covid-19 decimated tourism. We will help the village fisheries committee by guiding them and equipping them with them with bouys, kayaks, snorkel gear and training to demarcate and patrol protected seahorse habitats to keep the poachers out and let biodiversity to thrive.

mailing-address.narrative: Rua da Marginal 32a CP 16 Vilankulo, Inhambane 1304 Mozambique

title.narrative: Give 470 Colombian children a fair chance

description.narrative: This project will help the Portal Foundation protect and educate 470 children born to prison inmates or from low-income, vulnerable Colombian families. The Foundation, created in 1968 and located in the Picota prison in Bogota, is on the brink of collapse as revenue has dried up because of the Covid pandemic. The Foundation gives these children, ages 6 months to 12 years, opportunities to develop physically, intellectually, emotionally, and spiritually to become successful adults.

mailing-address.narrative: AC 51 SUR 5 F 50 Bogota, DC, DC 111841 Colombia

title.narrative: Educate 150 disabled girls amidst covid in mpigi

description.narrative: Girls with disabilities in our community suffer from sexual violence and education related challenges. This project will support 150 disabled girls in Mpigi district Uganda return back to school amidst COVID 19. It will provide scholastic materials including school bags, books, pens, sanitary towels and school uniforms. Hold Behavioral change, life skills, sexual reproductive health rights sessions with girls, parents $ care takers and hold community radio talk shows.

mailing-address.narrative: Disability Resource Centre, Mpigi district headquarters, Ugamda Mpigi, Mpigi district 127, Mpigi Uganda

title.narrative: Help Children Learn Online During Covid-19

description.narrative: MyBodhiTree.org is building Modern Learning Centers (MLCs) across Thailand within already established schools. We provide the equipment, online tools (and a fresh coat of paint for the room) so that teachers can continue teaching online even while quarantine measures are being implimented. With your help we can do this all for FREE.

mailing-address.narrative: 915 Keeneland Road Saint Louis, MO 63034 United States

title.narrative: 60 special children need your love during COVID-19

description.narrative: COVID-19 is a time when the 'HAVES' should help the 'HAVE NOTS'. This project is specifically aimed at sustaining 60 underprivileged families with seriously disabled special children, by providing much needed food and sanitary aids, Corona virus pandemic has affected people globally, confining them to their homes and denying them the means of earning and sustaining their families. Special children are the most affected as their cries fall on deaf ears. Our aim is to help such community.

mailing-address.narrative: #25, 2nd Main, S.K.Garden Bangalore, Karnataka 560046 India

description.narrative: This project aims to assist 7,000 vulnerable children and youth without family care or at risk of losing it, also assisting families who depend on our support, affected by COVID 19 pandemic. We would cover the basic needs in terms of food, hygiene, psychosocial and educational support at 5 provinces in Argentina: Lujan, Rosario, Mar del Plata, Cordoba and Obera.

mailing-address.narrative: Moreno 1850 5th floor Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires C1094ABB Argentina

title.narrative: Christmas boxes for children living in Refuges

description.narrative: Due to COVID-19 cases of Domestic abuse have risen dramatically. Many more children than ever before are now living in Refuges, as their homes are no longer safe. Parents are often not able to afford even basic necessities, as many families fled with just what they were wearing. Life is stressful enough for victims of violence but even more so at this time of year if you are worrying about the possibility of not having a Christmas/Seasonal Holiday gift for your child/ren on Christmas Day.

organisation.narrative: Rotary Club of Edgware and Stanmore

mailing-address.narrative: Stanmore Golf Club 29 Gordon Avenue Stanmore, Middlesex HA7 2RL United Kingdom

title.narrative: Outdoor Learning Space for Children in Rural Nepal

description.narrative: This project will support our two schools & a hostel facility in two remote villages in Kalikot district in Western Nepal to buy new land & to manage the existing lands to be used as outdoor playing, learning & farming spaces for 248 students at the schools & for 30 orphans & children in need of support at the hostel facility. Consequently, the children will continue their education, enjoy outdoor learning, & feel safer & comfortable at school during these difficult times of COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: 26895 Aliso Creek Rd Ste B1015 Aliso Viejo, CA 92656 United States

title.narrative: Clean Water for 1,500 Children in Uganda

description.narrative: 20 million Ugandans lack access to clean water, leading to easily preventable diseases. Among those most at risk are children, whose developing immune systems can't handle the physical stress imposed by COVID-19, malnutrition, and waterborne diseases (the #2 killer of children). We will install our Purifaaya filter, which eliminates 99.9% of bacteria from water, and our handiClean handwashing station, in three schools in the District of Mityana, impacting 1,500 children and their families.

mailing-address.narrative: 9416 Margail Ave Des Plaines, IL 60016 United States

title.narrative: Provide Fresh Meals to 30,000+ People in Florida

description.narrative: As COVID-19 continues to impact food security for many individuals, we must create more sustainable and viable options for producing healthy food in our communities. Marine Education Initiative seeks to launch an aquaponics food security effort to sustainably grow fresh vegetables and fish to help provide those in need with highly nutritious meals.

mailing-address.narrative: 9619 Nevada Place Boca Raton, FL 33434 United States

title.narrative: Save 200 mothers from preventable deaths in Ghana

description.narrative: African Health Now plans to provide prenatal and postpartum health education, support access and engagement in maternal health and reproductive services, and COVID-19 resources to 200 expecting mothers through their Pregnancy School Program initiative. Upon completion of the program, expecting mothers will receive African Health Now's signature Maternity Go-Box" equipped with personal hygiene products, diapers, and other supplies to support new mothers and baby's during their first few weeks.

mailing-address.narrative: 601 West 26th Street suite 325-252 New York, NY 10001 United States

title.narrative: Keep a Girl child safe and Educated in Malawi

description.narrative: A Girl Child is at risk of being raped, dropping out of school because of lack of academic resources, leading to early marriages. Malawi has registered an extremely increase (63%) in teen pregnancies and marriages especially during this period of COVID-19 pandemic. Our project aims at providing access to academic resources to the less privileged girl child learners around Ndirande community as a means to keep a girl child active and occupied. We will conduct awareness campaigns on sexual abuse.

mailing-address.narrative: P. O. Box 60180, Blantyre,Malawi Blantyre 265 Malawi

title.narrative: COVID-19: help women victims of violence

description.narrative: Since the beginning of the COVID-19 crisis, the number of calls from women victims of violence has increase by 70%. In only 2 months, we provided as much assistance as we did for the whole year least year. We provided urgent accommodation, psychological and financial support to over 70 women. We need to keep our effort to bring solutions to endangered women especially in these times of increased domestic violence. Help us to continue supporting abused women.

organisation.narrative: DOMINE - Organization for Promotion of Women's Rights

mailing-address.narrative: Bosanska 4 Split, Split/Split-Dalmatia County 21000 Croatia

title.narrative: Support 50 women ex-prisoners start life in Kenya

description.narrative: 346 Women prisoners inEldoret have been released in the wake of COVID 19. Re-entry services for women leaving prison are pretty much limited to not even a bus ticket home during release after spending months or years in prison, wherever that might be. While the biggest fear for a women ex-prisoners might be arrest, the biggest fear for women in general in prison is what will happen to them when they are released. These women have returned to their communities especially in the slum desperate

mailing-address.narrative: Langas Slum arcade, Eldoret, Uasin gGishu County, Western Kenya. P.O.Box 107-30100, Eldoret Eldoret 30100 Kenya

title.narrative: Support Enforcement of Covid-19 Protocol in Market

description.narrative: The project will educate and enforce social distancing guidelines and use of personal protection equipment in markets and parks in Karu LGA of Nasarawa State. Markets and Motor Parks are overcrowded and no physical distancing, no face masks wearing, no hand washing points in the entry and exit point. We will enforce adherance to covid-19 prevention protocol in this places, distribute face mask, soaps, hand gloves, sanitizers and setting-up handwashing facilities in 50 markets and parks

organisation.narrative: Poverty Alleviation Network & Self Dependence Initiative

mailing-address.narrative: KM 22 Abuja Keffi Road Abuja Abuja Nigeria

title.narrative: Lunch Donations to Nurses and Healthcare Workers

description.narrative: During COVID-19 pandemic, Go Only Electric is supporting the essential workers of our community with free lunches and donations of necessary medical supplies. With your help, we can continue this important non-profit work and continue to assist frontline staff and essential workers. But we cannot do it alone. Your support plays a key role. Underserved communities need your support today.

mailing-address.narrative: 32829 Pacific Hwy S #4631 Federal Way, WA 98003 United States

title.narrative: Rotary Walkathon for Northern Irish Charities

description.narrative: Members of the Rotary Club of Armagh will be walking at least 10,000 steps over the weekend of 5th and 6th December with President Ian hoping to do 50,000 in that period with the aim of raising much needed funds for 4 local Charities whose work has been substantially affected by COVID 19. Each club member has been asked to do this physical task as they spend more time at home. Through sponsorship and other donations our Rotarians are determined to reduce the gaps in funding.

mailing-address.narrative: Charlemont Arms Hotel 57-65 Upper English Street Armagh, N. Ireland BT61 7LB United Kingdom

description.narrative: This project will build the capacity of 50 women and 75 youth owned businesses which have been adversely affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in five communities in Ejisu Municipal, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Freeworld International plans to train the target groups on business sustainability strategies, assist them them with grants for business expansion and train them in four agricultural trades (Beekeeping, Piggery, Rabbit Production and Local Poultry) as supplementary livelihoods.

mailing-address.narrative: Opposite the office of the New Democratic Congress, Krapa, Off Konongo-Ejisu Road, Ejisu Municipal Ejisu-Krapa, Ashanti Region AE0017 Ghana

title.narrative: Support Spanish Primate Sanctuary During COVID-19

description.narrative: The Mona Foundation provides sanctuary for rescued chimpanzees, and other primates, where they can live out their lives in the most natural environment possible. The primates in our care have all been rescued from abusive or unsuitable situations. Many are from the pet trade or entertainment industries where they have lived through extremely traumatic events like seeing their family killed or suffering physical abuse. MONA rehabilitates these primates, as they cannot be returned to the wild.

mailing-address.narrative: Narcis Monturiol 5 Barcelona, Montornes del Valles 08170 Spain

title.narrative: Educational digital skills for children at risk

description.narrative: This project aims to guarantee access to formal education through the implementation of digital skills in children and adolescents at risk in the context of the post-COVID pandemic. The project will provide formal education, pedagogical support, homework support, internet access, workshops to improve digital skills and access to online educational content

mailing-address.narrative: Lucio Blanco 32, Colonia Revolucion , Alcaldia Venustiano Carranza Mexico 15460 Mexico

title.narrative: Home Safe Storage for Homeless/Unhoused Families

description.narrative: Housing is the foundation of personal and societal well-being and stability. Unfortunately, an eviction tsunami is coming, driven by COVID-19 & causing widespread unemployment especially in sectors employing many women. You can help unhoused women & children find affordable housing faster! They can seek right-sized less expensive housing when their belongings are safely stored. They will enjoy some peace of mind knowing they can start over with something rather than starting over with nothing.

mailing-address.narrative: 25661 Rolling Hills Rd Laguna Hills, CA 92653 United States

title.narrative: Hurricane Iota Cartagena CO Flooding Recovery

description.narrative: Hurricane Iota left 70% of Cartagena under water. The poverty rate there before the pandemic was 26%. After the months of lockdown, it increased to +40% as over 100,000 people lost their source of income. Covid was the first blow, now Iota dealt a second blow. This project is administered through Conviventia who will provide emergency relief to the worst affected families and give them a chance to rebuild their lives.

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 Broadfield Blvd, Suite 200 Houston, TX 77084-5162 United States

title.narrative: Stopping Deaths Caused by Antibiotic Resistance

description.narrative: Antibiotic-resistant infections are predicted to kill 10 million people each year by 2050 -- even more than the 1.4 million deaths caused by coronavirus during the first 11 months of the pandemic. Thus, we urgently need antibiotic alternatives, particularly in Africa and Asia where 90% of the antibiotic-resistant deaths will occur. Phages for Global Health helps scientists in Africa and Asia develop cheap, natural antibiotic alternatives (phages) that can kill antibiotic-resistant bacteria.

mailing-address.narrative: 383 62ND St Oakland, CA 94618 United States

title.narrative: Bring Soccer Balls To 100 Rwandan Boys and Girls

description.narrative: In 2013, the Bwiza Sun Team won second place at a Rwandan soccer competition - a great victory for the poorest kids around . COVID-19 interrupted team sports and now the boys and girls need equipment to be able to bring a team back together. Children and young people need joy and play in their lives. Happiness and social competition will grow their self-esteem and positive outlook on life, and will help the community address social problems like substance abuse, depression, and violence.

mailing-address.narrative: 4248 Chilberg Ave SW Apt. 403 Seattle, WA 98116 United States

description.narrative: In less than 2 weeks after Super Typhoon Goni (Rolly) made landfall in the Philippines, another Category 2 Typhoon -Typhoon Vamco (Ulysses) struck the island of Luzon last Nov 11, 2020. Barely recovering from the first typhoon and with the threat of COVID-19 still remaining, families in poor communities are at risk of facing hunger daily. Flooding has left many without homes and access to food. This project will provide Food Relief to assist thousands of families during this time of crisis.

organisation.narrative: Reach Out and Feed Philippines Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: 6/F Cyber One Building, 11 Eastwood Avenue Eastwood City Cyberpark, Bagumbayan, Quezon City, Quezon City 1110 Philippines

title.narrative: Provision of Food and Medical to 45 children

description.narrative: The project will provide nutritious food and medical assistance to 45 abandoned children for better growth and development. To help the children to recover from malnourishment and boost their immune system for better living specially this time of COVID 19 pandemic.

organisation.narrative: Tahanan ng Pagmamahal Children's Home, Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: #45 Dr. Pilapil Street, Barangay Sagad Pasig City 1600 Philippines

title.narrative: Covid-19 Hygiene Supplies for Rural Health Centers

description.narrative: We will provide much-needed hygiene supplies comprising face masks, alcohol, soap and compact hand washing stations to 125 rural health centers in Misamis Oriental province. The Covid-19 pandemic has decimated supplies in health centers located in rural areas and the need to re-supply them is urgent with government agencies favoring the provision of supplies to large health facilities located in the city.

organisation.narrative: Water, Agroforestry, Nutrition and Development Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: Libertad Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental 9021 Philippines

title.narrative: Empower Guatemalan students through digital tools

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has sent home more than 4 million children and youths in Guatemala. The already fragile education system within the country seems more threatened than ever. This program that will benefit more than 100 families seeks to improve the mental health of students, teachers, and parents, reduce the digital gap and facilitate learning and educational enrichment now and in case of future educational disruptions.

mailing-address.narrative: Calle de Emperador no. 5 San Pedro El Panorama Antigua, Sacatepequez 03001 Guatemala

description.narrative: THE ROTARY CLUB OF BALLYCASTLE , NORTHERN IRELAND annually raise funds for local charities by selling yellow ribbons which are then put on the Christmas Tree to remember loved ones not with us and , in doing so, raising much needed funds for local charities whose essential work has been adversely impacted by Covid 19.

mailing-address.narrative: 23 Lisnagat Road Armoy Ballymoney, Antrim BT53 8UN United Kingdom

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has created massive unbudgeted and unforeseen costs. Despite these added challenges, RAM continues provide free dental, medical, and vision care at our clinics. Please join RAM during this global holiday giving season, which launches on #GivingTuesday, December 1, and runs through the end of the year. We thank you for your support as we provide free, quality healthcare to those in need. Donate now and give the gift of #healthyholidays.

mailing-address.narrative: 2200 Stock Creek Blvd. Rockford, Tennessee 37853 United States

title.narrative: Community Based Education During a Pandemic

description.narrative: The COVID pandemic has interrupted the progress made in this rural community over the last ten years. Our young students could hope for new career opportunities in engineering, technology, banking, or teaching. They could plan for more education. All this is threatened by the pandemic. We are providing community based school every day so that children don't lose their hard won learning. More than 100 children attend. We need more supplies, books, paper, tablets, chairs and tables.

mailing-address.narrative: 3 Oak St Newburyport, MA 01950 United States

description.narrative: In this Covid-19 period, GESL has maintained our programming & support of girls. Through our SHE series (Staying Safe, Healthy, & Empowered), we've been able to maintain our girls' learning & skill development through videos/podcasts/posters. Our IGNITE E-learning Series has held virtual classes for girls throughout the West African region. Through donations, we've provided emergency support to girls & families. Our passion is keeping our girls safe,& we hope you'll help us continue our mission!

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 731 Mount Laurel, NJ 08054 United States

description.narrative: For 36 years, our organization has focused on establishing health justice for migrant and mobile populations by providing support services to the frontline clinicians who work with them. In 2020, the global pandemic has presented unparalleled challenges to the frontline clinicians confronting COVID-19 within these populations and beyond. Their efforts have made our work possible, and that is why we have decided to focus our GivingTuesday campaign on celebrating all of our #HeroesOnTheFrontline.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 164285 Austin, Texas 78716-4285 United States

title.narrative: Don't Let COVID Keep Kids Off The Diamond

description.narrative: COVID continues to adversely impact each of us. Often forgotten is the lack of safe recreational activities for our children. In response to the pandemic, the CDC has instituted stricter safety regulations that require children to use his/her own equipment to return to safe play; thus, children can no longer share equipment. This change has tripled the demand for equipment requests from our organization. Help us ensure kids can get outside and play baseball and softball during the pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: 1563-65 Gehman Road Harleysville, Pa 19438 United States

title.narrative: Sponsor Online Learning at an Afghan Girls' School

description.narrative: The School of Leadership, Afghanistan (SOLA) is Afghanistan's first and only private boarding school for girls, with 82 students in grades 6-10. This project will enhance our capacity to maintain continuity of learning during the ongoing COVID-19 outbreak, allowing us to safely offer our students a fully remote and online educational environment.

mailing-address.narrative: 470 Atlantic Ave 4th Floor Boston, MA 02110 United States

title.narrative: Providing school lunches to kids in Mozambique

description.narrative: This project will provide daily school lunches to 1,200 students across six rural primary schools in Mozambique. The closure of schools in early 2020 due to COVID-19 has increased child hunger and put more kids at risk of dropping out of school. As Mozambique reopens schools for the 2021 academic year, this school lunch program will be even more critical to get students back in school and ensure they have the nutrition they need to grow and learn.

mailing-address.narrative: 5105 S PARK LANE SPOKANE, WA 99223 United States

description.narrative: Students in Tanzania missed 3.5 months of school due to COVID-19, causing us to realize our programs are in need of an upgrade to respond to the special challenges these children are now facing. Therefore, this Giving Season, The Toa Nafasi Project is seeking support for our special needs students affected by the pandemic through two significant interventions: 1) Learning and Testing, and 2) Health and Hunger.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 1677 Moshi, Kilimanjaro - Tanzania, United Republic of

title.narrative: Violence prevention to indigenous girls COVID time

description.narrative: Through a social and emotional learning (SEL) program, this project will help 1,200 indigenous girls in Chiapas during the pandemic, to strengthen their abilities and take care of their emotions in order to prevent gender violence and school drop-out during the pandemic. We are working with small groups in outdoor spaces to provide emotional support to girls, organize workshops to avoid school dropout, sports and artistic activities and create radio spots in indigenous languages to prevent COVID

description.narrative: The project will empower 50 caregivers who are survivors of violence and their businesses was affected by the Covid 19 pandemic and Economic recession in Nigeria. OCDI plans to mentor and support the beneficiaries in running a successful business till their businesses becomes stable again and they in turn become financially independent.

title.narrative: Help Make Santa's Visit to IBSF Kids a Reality!

description.narrative: Our annual Christmas party is coming up on December 11, 2020. This year has been particularly difficult for many of our students due to effects of Covid-19 & we wanted to help bring some holiday cheer to them. Having this Christmas party will allow our students to celebrate with each other, enjoy some refreshments & take home gift items. Your donation & support will be instrumental to making this a reality. Thank you for your continued support of IBSF. We wish you all lots of blessings.

mailing-address.narrative: 2 Lateef Jakande Ikoyi, Lagos N/A Nigeria

title.narrative: Covid-19: Supporting street children in Mumbai

description.narrative: This project will provide support and information to 600 street children and their families during the Covid-19 pandemic in Mumbai. Forced to survive in the streets, the pandemic and the lockdown have put them in a very vulnerable position. Making use of a mobile unit, called the "Smiling Bus", we will provide them with support, resources and information to help them dealing with this terrible situation.

mailing-address.narrative: C. Pelai 32, 2 Barcelona 08001 Spain

title.narrative: A Covid Xmas: Gift 150 Cancer & DV Survivors

description.narrative: Trapped in the Discomfort of Home! COVID-19 has destroyed countless lives & thrust millions into needless suffering. The Masses have lost their zeal for life & hope for tomorrow! This Xmas let's make a difference to remind us Daily that Together, We're Stronger Than any Obstacle! Working Together we provide Masks, Food, Supplies, Gifts & Support to Survivors and Thrivers! Proving that Social Distancing is Not Social Isolation! We Are in this Together & We Will Win!

organisation.narrative: True Help & Empowerment for Women & Aspiring Youth Foundation USA

mailing-address.narrative: 9203 Hwy 6 South, Suite #124-236 Houston, TX 77083 United States

description.narrative: Having to climb a tree for making a call or have enough internet signal to send a message, walk more than two hours to a hill or ride kilometers in a motorcycle to reach the nearest village and get three lines of phone signal that allows internet connection is what most rural youths and children must do during COVID-19 to access education, information, and opportunities. We aim to provide rural youths with a connectivity KIT with energy and internet access and essential IT equipment.#CloseTheGap

title.narrative: MAMA Kits for Expectant Mothers, Baringo, Kenya

description.narrative: This project will provide 100 covid-19 maternity kits equipped with surgical gloves, medicott sanitary towel, cotton wool, surgical blade, umbilical cord knot, disinfectant, gauze, baby wrapper, baby blanket, bibs, toiletry bag and face mask. The delivery kits will restore dignity of expectant mothers seeking services of unskilled traditional birth attendants. Proper equipment reduces chances of complicated birthing and infections.

title.narrative: Bright Christmas 2020 for children of Covid year.

description.narrative: A & V Rhythmic club bringing together young girls from diverse backgrounds and to make them feel included in the sport and community through Christmas party and Christmas gifts. Covid 19 has ripped though families and grounded UK economy. Lockdown has affected children's mental health, boredom, stress and loneliness is a reality for many kids in lockdown. Many children said that their club is very important for their wellbeing over the lockdown and have look forward to Xmas performance.
